problem.description: Find maximum number of isosceles triangles with 2+ good sides
problem.good_diagonal_definition: Divides boundary into two odd-length parts

consecutive_triangle_analysis.note: All triangles (i, i+1, i+2) are isosceles with 2 good sides

main_result_2006.explanation:
OPTIMAL DISSECTION STRATEGY:

        Key observation: Triangles with vertices (i, i+1, i+2) are ideal:
        - They have sides connecting consecutive vertices: (i,i+1), (i+1,i+2), (i,i+2)
        - Sides (i,i+1) and (i+1,i+2) both have arc length 1 (GOOD)
        - Side (i,i+2) has arc length 2 (NOT GOOD since 2 is even)
        - Triangle is ISOSCELES: chord(i,i+1) = chord(i+1,i+2)
        - Has exactly 2 good sides!

        For a 2006-gon dissection:
        - We need 2004 triangles total (using 2003 diagonals)
        - We can include 1003 triangles of type (i, i+1, i+2)
        - Each contributes 1 isosceles triangle with 2 good sides
        - The remaining 1001 triangles fill the gaps

        Dissection construction:
        - Use consecutive triple triangles where possible
        - Fill remaining space with other triangles
        - This achieves the maximum of 1003

patterns.good_diagonals: A diagonal from i to j is good iff |j-i| is odd
patterns.consecutive_triple_pattern: Triangles (i, i+1, i+2) are isosceles with exactly 2 good sides
patterns.isosceles_count: Maximum achieved with consecutive-triple dissection strategy

answer.strategy: Consecutive-triple triangulation with (i, i+1, i+2) triangles
answer.explanation:
OPTIMAL DISSECTION STRATEGY:

        Key observation: Triangles with vertices (i, i+1, i+2) are ideal:
        - They have sides connecting consecutive vertices: (i,i+1), (i+1,i+2), (i,i+2)

        - Side (i,i+2) has arc length 2 (NOT GOOD since 2 is even)
        - Triangle is ISOSCELES: chord(i,i+1) = chord(i+1,i+2)
        - Has exactly 2 good sides!

        For a 2006-gon dissection:
        - We need 2004 triangles total (using 2003 diagonals)
        - We can include 1003 triangles of type (i, i+1, i+2)
        - Each contributes 1 isosceles triangle with 2 good sides
        - The remaining 1001 triangles fill the gaps

        - Use consecutive triple triangles where possible
        - Fill remaining space with other triangles
